articles.author: Vaamanaa Sethi
articles.title: Tolins Tyres files draft papers with SEBI to raise ₹230 crore via IPO | Mint - Mint
articles.description: According to the draft prospectus filed on February 16, the IPO will comprise a combination of fresh issuance of equity shares amounting to  ₹200 crore, and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of shares valued at  ₹30 crore by the company's promoters.
articles.content: Kerala-based Tolins Tyres has filed preliminary papers to the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) to raise 230 crore through an initial public offering (IPO). According to the draft prospec… [+2722 chars]

articles.author: Kshitij Anand
articles.title: Technical Breakout Stocks: How to trade Adani Ports, Maruti Suzuki and Bajaj Auto on Monday - The Economic Times
articles.description: Adani Port has given a breakout of the Rising Wedge Pattern on a weekly time frame on the upside with an increase in volume indicating an uptrend. Price is trading above Fast (50) and Slow (200) EMA, which also indicates an uptrend in the security.
articles.content: The Indian market closed higher for the fourth consecutive day on Friday, tracking positive global cues.The S&P BSE Sensex rose more than 300 points, while the Nifty50 closed above 22,000 levels.… [+2733 chars]

articles.title: Can FY25 break NMDC’s momentum? | Mint - Mint
articles.description: While NMDC expects a roughly 20% volume increase in FY24 on a lower base, growth is expected to slow down in FY25
articles.content: Investors in NMDC Ltd have had a fruitful year, with the stock climbing over 70% in 2023 and a nearly 17% increase so far in 2024. The state-owned iron ore miner's performance has been buoyed by two … [+2197 chars]

articles.title: Two-wheeler industry to see double-digit revenue growth next fiscal: Hero MotoCorp CEO | Mint - Mint
articles.description: Two-wheeler industry to see double-digit revenue growth next fiscal, the demand for premium models is likely to escalate further, said Hero MotoCorp CEO Niranjan Gupta.

articles.title: Six of top 10 companies take a Rs 71,414-crore hit to market value; LIC and TCS biggest laggards - The Economic Times
articles.description: On the other hand, State Bank of India, Infosys, HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank were emerged as the gainers. They collectively added Rs 62,038.86 crore.
